revised_title: Rigorous Bounds on Conductivity of Random Arrays of Cylinders
tldr: This article presents rigorous third-order and fourth-order bounds on the effective conductivity of a composite material composed of aligned, infinitely long, equisized, rigid, circular cylinders randomly distributed throughout a matrix. The authors simplify the key multidimensional integral using Chebyshev polynomials and calculate the microstructural parameter for an equilibrium distribution of cylinders. The results improve upon second-order bounds and provide good estimates of conductivity for various phase conductivities and volume fractions.
